id: Issue ID (e.g. INT-XXX) - only necessary to update issues
project_key: Project ID (e.g. INT) - mandatory for creating issues
issue_type: e.g. Story, Epic, Xray Test... - mandatory for creating issues
epic_name: The name of the Epic - mandatory when creating an issue of type Epic
epic_link_id: The ID of the Epic to where the issue will be linked (e.g. INT-XXX) - optional
summary: The title of the issue - mandatory when creating an issue
feasability: The issue feasability (e.g. Orange - Needs More Definition)

components.name: The issue components (e.g. Actions API, Integrations UI...) - optional, but there can be several components

labels: The issue labels (e.g. asgard, tech-debt, automated_test) - optional, but there can be several labels

releases.name: The Fix Versions names (e.g. Fall'21, Parking Lot) - optional, but there can be several releases

dependencies.dependency_type: Which kind of dependency the issue has (e.g. relates to, is tested by) - optional
dependencies.key: The issue of the ID that is a dependency - mandatory if the dependency type is defined

test_type: The kind of test (e.g. Manual, Automated) - optional and only necessary for Xray Test issue type. If not filled, a Manual test type will be created by default

steps.action: The conditions to prepare the test
steps.result: The expected result for the test
And these fields can be filled as intended
